Dialogue.NPCText:
A slender woman in a gown of woven embers tends a sacred fire, her gaze never meeting yours. Her voice is low, distant, like wind through coals.

“Careful, outsider. The Everflame listens even now. Look not into my eyes — I see through fire’s truth, and fire curses the soul that stares back.”

“Why do you disturb the fire’s vigil? Do you seek guidance, or do the spirits whisper trouble at your heels?”

Option.text: I wish to learn what the Everflame sees.
You speak of curses and spirits. Are you the tribe’s oracle?
I bring a warning. Some say a traitor walks among the tribe.
Tell me more about you, Zeela.
I was just curious. Farewell.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zeela keeps her face turned toward the flames.

“Oracle, some say. Fool, others. I am the Fire Keeper — the flames remember, they warn, and sometimes they burn. I speak their warnings, though few heed them.”
“Most would rather risk a traitor than face the truth fire brings. But you… will you listen?”

Option.text: I will listen. What do the flames say?
Why do they call you a fool?
Maybe another time.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Because fire shows what others fear to see. The tribe fears the word ‘traitor’ more than betrayal itself. They call me mad so they can sleep at night.”
“But you came to listen. So I will speak — if you dare hear the flame’s secrets.”

Option.text: Let me hear the fire's warning.
I should go. This is not my concern.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zeela tosses a fragrant herb into the Everflame, and the smoke twists into faces.

“The fire spirit whispers of shadows hiding within leaves. Someone among us walks with another’s tongue, passing secrets where only the trees listen.”
“Find the one whose hands tremble at dawn, whose eyes never meet their kin. If you bring me proof, the fire may name the traitor.”

[You have received the quest: Flames of Betrayal]

Option.text: How can I gather proof?
What do you know of this traitor?
I accept this quest.
That’s too dangerous for me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zeela nods, still not meeting your gaze.
“Bring me what the traitor hides: a torn scrap of cloak stained with ash. It will smell of burnt leaves and false promises. Only then can the fire spirit reveal what must be done.”
“Trust no one in shadows. And do not look into the flames too long, lest you see your own secrets staring back.”

Option.text: I will return with proof.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Watch the council at dawn — one will avoid the fire’s warmth and speak with a trembling voice. Search their hut, and you may find what is hidden: a cloak torn by thorns, reeking of ash.”
“Bring it here, and the flames will answer.”

Option.text: I’ll investigate the council members.
Option.action: SendMessage:You have a clue: watch the council at dawn.

Option.text: Is the traitor dangerous?
I will begin at once.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“A shadow-walker, once of the tribe. They bear a mark burned by Minax’s magic, hidden beneath their sleeve. They act for fear, not hate.”
“They are desperate — cornered prey. Show mercy if you can, but justice must be done.”

Option.text: If I find the cloak, I’ll return to you.
Perhaps there’s another way?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“If you believe a soul can be redeemed, bring them to the Everflame at midnight. The fire spirit may judge them worthy of forgiveness — or burn away their lies.”
“But mercy is never free. Be sure before you act.”

Option.text: Thank you, Zeela. I will decide when the time comes.
Better to let the flames decide.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zeela’s hands still as she listens.
“You see what others will not speak. The Everflame has whispered this for nights. If you seek the truth, listen to the fire, not the frightened tongues of mortals.”
“Will you seek proof, or merely spread more fear?”

Option.text: I will find the proof for you.
It is not my place to meddle.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zeela takes the torn, ashen cloak you offer. Flames leap higher, casting strange shadows.
“The spirit sees the truth now. You have served the tribe — and the fire — well.”
“Take this charm, woven from the Everflame itself. May it guard you against shadows yet to come.”

Option.text: Thank you, Zeela. May the Everflame watch over us all.

Dialogue.NPCText:
You lead the trembling traitor to Zeela at midnight. She chants softly, casting sacred herbs into the fire. The spirit’s voice is heard only in your mind — a sound like distant thunder.
“Mercy given, mercy earned. The tribe is made whole, though scars remain. Take this — a blessing from the Everflame, for wisdom and courage.”
“Guard your heart from shadow, as you did theirs.”

Option.text: I accept this blessing.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zeela finally looks up, her amber eyes flickering with reflected flame.
“Go, now. The fire is restless — and there are always more secrets waiting to burn.”

Zeela shifts slightly, still avoiding your eyes.

“Few ask. Fewer listen.”
“I was born during a forest fire — the trees screamed, the animals fled. The elders said the flames licked my cradle but did not consume it.”
“So I was given to the Everflame — to hear it, to tend it, to serve it.”
“They say I’m fire-touched. Perhaps I am. But it is the fire that saved me — not the tribe.”

Option.text: Were you ever part of the council?
Why do you never look anyone in the eye?
You were chosen by the flame?
That sounds like a lonely path.
That’s enough for now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“They offered me a seat once. I refused.”
“The Everflame has no voice among the council. It whispers what they do not wish to hear. And I will not silence it to sit among them.”

“Besides... if I joined them, I would see their eyes. I would know what each fears most. And they would know I saw it.”

Option.text: So you chose isolation instead.
Your duty is heavier than any council title.
Let's speak of something else.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zeela’s head tilts, and her voice softens.

“The fire gave me sight — not of the world, but of hearts. When I look into someone’s eyes, I see their regrets. Their shame. Their lies.”
“And sometimes... their death.”
“The last time I met a gaze, I saw my sister’s bones before the wolves found her. I warned her not to go. She did not listen.”

Option.text: You’ve carried much alone.
You see the truth in others... and yourself?
I'm sorry for your loss.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I was chosen, yes. Not by the tribe, but by the flame.”
“The Everflame speaks in crackle and ember. Its voice is not kind — but it is true. It warned me when the Verdant Grove cracked. It showed me the symbols Minax burned into the trees.”
“And now... it shows me you.”

Option.text: What does it say about me?
What does it say about me?
What if the flame is wrong?
That’s... unsettling.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zeela’s voice is almost reverent.

“It sees your path forked between sacrifice and salvation.”
“One day you will stand before the tribe, with blood on one hand and light in the other. Whether you are healer or executioner — that choice is yours.”
“But the flame believes you can endure the burden.”

Option.text: I will strive to be worthy of that faith.
I don’t know if I can carry that.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zeela frowns slightly.

“The fire does not speak clearly of you. It sees smoke. Obscurity. A blade that might cut inward or out.”
“Some fires cleanse. Some consume. I hope you learn the difference.”

Option.text: I will prove the fire wrong.
Then I will be its wildfire.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zeela’s mouth tightens, just barely.

“The flame is never wrong. But *I* might be.”
“If ever I speak falsely, may the Everflame turn cold.”
She pauses.
“It hasn’t. Yet.”

Option.text: Then I will trust you... and it.
Flame or not, truth must be earned.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“The fire speaks often. People do not.”
“But silence teaches patience. And truth.”
“Besides... you are speaking now, aren’t you?”

Option.text: Yes. And I will listen more closely from now on.
Everyone needs someone to speak to.
Maybe the Everflame sent me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Yes. That is the burden of true sight.”
“I see the cowardice I did not confess. The warning I failed to shout. The choice I didn’t make in time.”
“I live beside the Everflame not because I am brave... but because it reminds me of what I must never become again.”

Option.text: We all carry pain. But you carry it with purpose.
Maybe it’s time you forgave yourself.
Pain makes strong walls. But poor doors.
